questiontext.text:
Find the values of x for which the following matrix has no inverse :

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-1 &1 &3 \\3 &-5 &x \\x &-5 &-3\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Express the answers upto 3 significant figures and in increasing order such that x1 < x2

x1 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-14.544:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}x2 ={1:NUMERICAL:=2.544:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-1 &1 &3 \\3 &-5 &x \\x &-5 &-3\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$\small-1((15) - (-5x)) - (1)((-9) - x^{2}) + (3)((-15) - (-5x)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\smallx^{2}+12x-37 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-14.544$$
$$\small x_{2} =2.544$$
